Uses of Class
commands.Command

  • Packages that use Command 
    Package Description
    commands  
    io  
    runtime  

    • Uses of Command in commands

      Subclasses of Command in commands 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  ChangeDirectory
      Change directory to DIR, which may be relative to the current directory or may be a full path.
      class  ClientUrl
      Takes a url and then creates a file in the current directory containing the contents of the file at the given url
      class  Concatenate
      Takes in an array of tokens from execution and executes the Concatenate command.
      class  Copy
      Makes a copy of a file or directory
      class  Echo
      Takes in an array of tokens from execution and executes the Echo command.
      class  Exit
      Quit the program.
      class  History
      Access the History data of the current session of the java shell and print it out.
      class  ListContents
      Lists the contents of the current or given directory(s).
      class  LoadJShell
      Loads a .ser save such that the full state of the shell is loaded into an empty JShell.
      class  MakeDirectory
      This command takes in two arguments only.
      class  Manual
      Takes in an array of tokens from execution and executes the Manual command.
      class  Move
      Move moves a file or directory to the desired location
      class  PopDirectory
      Allows user to get the most recent directory from the stack, pop it, and change directory into it.
      class  PrintWorkingDirectory
      Print the current working directory (including the whole path).
      class  PushDirectory
      Allows user to push current directory to directory stack and change directories to a directory they give.
      class  Redirection
      Takes in an array of tokens and redirects output to a file.
      class  Remove
      Removes a directory from the filesystem
      class  SaveJShell
      Saves the full state of the shell in a .ser file that can be loaded in an empty JShell.
      class  Search
      Searches through a list of given directories and their sub-directories and then outputs whether the list directories contain the desired file or not
      class  Tree
      Tree displays the FileSystem as a tree structure
      Methods in commands that return Command 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Command Command.checkRun​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      Checks if tokens has a valid redirection
      Command CommandInterface.checkRun​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      Checks if tokens has a valid redirection
      Command ChangeDirectory.run​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      The run method of ChangeDirectory changes the currentDirectory of the fileSystem to the given path tokens[1] if it is a valid/appropriate Directory path in fileSystem and not a File path, otherwise, give back an error message.
      Command ClientUrl.run​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      Retrieves file at given URL and inserts at current directory.
      Command Command.run​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      Runs the command (to be implemented for each command, overridden by each subclass).
      Command CommandInterface.run​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      Runs the command (to be implemented for each command, overridden by each subclass).
      Command Concatenate.run​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      Prints the contents of a specified file to the terminal.
      Command Copy.run​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      The run method of Copy copies a FileSystemNode into another FileSystemNode or copies a File into another FileSystemNode or overwrites a file into another File path that already exists or copies the content of a file into another File path
      Command Echo.run​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      Print STRING to terminal, writes STRING to a new file, overrides contents of a file if file already exists and/or appends STRING to a file.
      Command Exit.run​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      When exit is run, it sends signal to terminate.
      Command History.run​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      Prints out the recent commands, one command per line.
      Command ListContents.run​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      If no paths are given, print the contents (file or directory) of the current directory, with a new line following each of the content (file or directory).
      Command LoadJShell.run​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      Given a .ser file save, then load the save into an empty JShell
      Command MakeDirectory.run​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      The run method of MakeDirectory makes two directories in the given path tokens[1] and tokens[2] if both paths are valid/appropriate in fileSystem, or makes a directory in the path tokens[1] if tokens[1] is a valid/appropriate path in fileSystem but tokens[2] is not, or makes no directories at all if tokens[1] is not a valid/appropriate path in fSystem.
      Command Manual.run​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      Prints out documentation for a specified command from tokens
      Command Move.run​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      The run method of Move moves a FileSystemNode into another directory or moves a File into another FileSystemNode or overwrites a file into another file path that already exists or copies the content of a file into another file path
      Command PopDirectory.run​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      Remove the top entry from the directory stack, and cd into it.
      Command PrintWorkingDirectory.run​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      The run method of PrintWorkingDirectory displays the full path of the currentDirectory in fileSystem and returns true after being done.
      Command PushDirectory.run​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      Saves the current working directory by pushing onto directory stack and then changes the new current working directory to DIR.
      Command Redirection.run​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      Writes OUTPUT to a new file, overrides contents of a file if file already exists and/or appends OUTPUT to a file.
      Command Remove.run​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      The run method of Remove removes the directory that the tokens[1] refers to and deletes all the paths in the stack that depended on tokens[1] if tokens[1] is a valid/proper path, otherwise, it displays an error message and return true.
      Command SaveJShell.run​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      Creates a save .ser file and stores it in the actual computer filesystem
      Command Search.run​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      Searches through a list of directories/paths and outputs whether the specified file is located in given directories/paths.
      Command Tree.run​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      The run method of Tree displays the fSystem as a tree structure of subdirectories and files then return this Command with its output and errors

    • Uses of Command in io

      Methods in io with parameters of type Command 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static java.lang.String StandardOutput.println​(java.lang.String[] tokens, java.lang.String output, JShell shell, Command command)
      Takes an output and redirects it appropriately

    • Uses of Command in runtime

      Methods in runtime that return Command 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Command Execution.executeCommand​(java.lang.String[] tokens, JShell shell)
      Takes in an array of tokens and attempts to execute a command.
      Methods in runtime with parameters of type Command 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static java.lang.String ErrorHandler.badInput​(Command command, java.lang.String message)
      Prints badInput error message
      static java.lang.String ErrorHandler.changeDirectoryIntoFileError​(Command command, java.lang.String targetPath)
      changeDirectoryIntoFileError returns the error of targetPath refering to a File so you cannot change directory
      static java.lang.String ErrorHandler.copyDirectoryIntoFileError​(Command command, java.lang.String givenPath, java.lang.String targetPath)
      copyDirectoryIntoFileError returns an error for invalid copy direcoty
      static java.lang.String ErrorHandler.fileAlreadyExist​(Command command, java.lang.String file)
      Prints fileAlreadyExist error message
      static java.lang.String ErrorHandler.inappropriatePath​(Command command, java.lang.String givenPath)
      Prints inappropriatePath error message
      static java.lang.String ErrorHandler.invalidComboOfParams​(Command command, java.lang.String[] tokens)
      Prints invalidComboOfParams error message
      static java.lang.String ErrorHandler.invalidName​(Command command, java.lang.String token)
      Prints invalidName error message
      static java.lang.String ErrorHandler.invalidPath​(Command command, java.lang.String invalidPath)
      Prints invalidPath error message
      static java.lang.String ErrorHandler.invalidUrl​(Command command, java.lang.String url)
      Prints invalidUrl error message
      static java.lang.String ErrorHandler.missingOperand​(Command command)
      Prints missingOperand error message
      static java.lang.String ErrorHandler.missingString​(Command command, java.lang.String[] tokens)
      Prints missingString error message
      static java.lang.String ErrorHandler.moveDirectoryIntoFileError​(Command command, java.lang.String givenPath, java.lang.String targetPath)
      moveDirectoryIntoFileError returns the error of givenPath being a path to a FileSystemNode and targetPath being a File path so you cannot move the directory
      static java.lang.String ErrorHandler.subFileSystemNodeError​(Command command, java.lang.String givenPath, java.lang.String targetPath)
      subFileSystemNodeError returns the error of targetPath being inside the givenPath
      static java.lang.String ErrorHandler.tooManyArguments​(Command command)
      Prints tooManyArguments error message
